values.description:
Some dependencies were accidentally removed from `IGN_MATH_DEPENDENCIES` in pull request #822:

* #!/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/822/trusty-eol-remove-all-references-to-trusty/diff?w=1#comment-110769045
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-bionic-amd64&build=11)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-bionic-amd64/11/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-bionic-amd64/11/

This restores them. Testing:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-bionic-amd64&build=12)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-bionic-amd64/12/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-ign-math4-bionic-amd64/12/

values.description:
Together with: [https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pull/8](https://github.com/osrf/gzdev/pull/8)

Note: debian sid images report the name of Buster so we need to force the linux\_distro value in gzdev calls to get sid instead of Buster.

values.description:
The docker cache is making gzdev call to fail if the interface changed in the scripts since it is not pulling changes always. This PR make so in the case of failure.

Tested here \(previously failing\):

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math5-install-pkg-xenial-amd64&build=286)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_math5-install-pkg-xenial-amd64/286/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math5-install-pkg-xenial-amd64/286/))
values.title: pull gzdev changes from github if the command fails due to docker cache

values.description:
This PR modifies the CI jobs for subt:

* New[ job -ci\_long-](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci_long-default-bionic-amd64/) to run subt testing script for one hour every night
* Integration with Bitbucket status via -ci-pr\_any- script
* Remove all job to test installation of subt package alone

Working on fixing the failing tests.
values.title: Improve subt CI: new long run overnight and integration with bitbucket

summary.raw:
This PR modifies the CI jobs for subt:

* New[ job -ci\_long-](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci_long-default-bionic-amd64/) to run subt testing script for one hour every night
* Integration with Bitbucket status via -ci-pr\_any- script
* Remove all job to test installation of subt package alone

Working on fixing the failing tests.
summary.html:
This PR modifies the CI jobs for subt:

  • New job -ci_long- to run subt testing script for one hour every night
  • Integration with Bitbucket status via -ci-pr_any- script
  • Remove all job to test installation of subt package alone

Working on fixing the failing tests.

values.description:
In order to get right testing for the subt project we need to install:

* husky\_description
* jackal\_description
* pointgrey\_camera\_driver

For the pointgrey\_camera\_driver the SDK is needed, which requires manual installation. I did that on our Jenkins nodes host system.

Testing with `tunnel_circuit` current default \(report 3 test failures\):

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64&build=467)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr\_any-bionic-amd64/467/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/467/))

Testing with `tunnel_circuit_fixsing_deps` branch \(report 1 test failures\):

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64&build=464)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr\_any-bionic-amd64/464/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/464/))

The PR includes a fix in the DSL to stop using branch default in -ci-pr\_any-
values.title: Fix subt CI test failures: needs more packages for testing

summary.html:
In order to get right testing for the subt project we need to install:

  • husky_description
  • jackal_description
  • pointgrey_camera_driver

For the pointgrey_camera_driver the SDK is needed, which requires manual installation. I did that on our Jenkins nodes host system.

Testing with tunnel_circuit current default (report 3 test failures):

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/467/)

Testing with tunnel_circuit_fixsing_deps branch (report 1 test failures):

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/464/)

The PR includes a fix in the DSL to stop using branch default in -ci-pr_any-

values.description:
Currently drogon has an installation of nvidia-docker2. This PR support the differences between nvidia-docker1 and nvidia-docker2 until all the nodes are migrated to nvidia-docker2.

The node has to delcare the NVIDIA\_DOCKER2\_NODE as true in the node environment variables:

Tested:

* nvidia-docker2 in drogon:

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64_test_drogon&build=4)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_gazebo-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64\_test\_drogon/4/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64_test_drogon/4/))


* nvidia-docker1 in optimus:

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=1944)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_gazebo-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/1944/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1944/))
values.title: Support for nodes with nvidia-docker2

summary.raw:
Currently drogon has an installation of nvidia-docker2. This PR support the differences between nvidia-docker1 and nvidia-docker2 until all the nodes are migrated to nvidia-docker2.

The node has to delcare the NVIDIA\_DOCKER2\_NODE as true in the node environment variables:

Tested:

* nvidia-docker2 in drogon:

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64_test_drogon&build=4)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_gazebo-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64\_test\_drogon/4/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64_test_drogon/4/))


* nvidia-docker1 in optimus:

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=1944)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_gazebo-ci-pr\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/1944/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1944/))
summary.html:
Currently drogon has an installation of nvidia-docker2. This PR support the differences between nvidia-docker1 and nvidia-docker2 until all the nodes are migrated to nvidia-docker2.

The node has to delcare the NVIDIA_DOCKER2_NODE as true in the node environment variables:

Tested:

  • nvidia-docker2 in drogon:

    https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64_test_drogon/4/)

  • nvidia-docker1 in optimus:

    https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/1944/)

values.description: Some smoke testing builds are frozen. For some reason the timeout command is unable to kill the ign launch command. This PR removes the smoke testing for the main -ci-pr\_any- jobs leaving the usual build \+ test until we can fix the ign launch invocation.
values.title: Do not run smoke test in subt ci to avoid hangs in main CI

summary.raw: Some smoke testing builds are frozen. For some reason the timeout command is unable to kill the ign launch command. This PR removes the smoke testing for the main -ci-pr\_any- jobs leaving the usual build \+ test until we can fix the ign launch invocation.
summary.html: Some smoke testing builds are frozen. For some reason the timeout command is unable to kill the ign launch command. This PR removes the smoke testing for the main -ci-pr_any- jobs leaving the usual build + test until we can fix the ign launch invocation.

values.description:
New testing job to test nvidia-docker2 in nvidia-docker2. Used for running the dockerhub subt image: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-install-dockerhub-bionic-amd64](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-install-dockerhub-bionic-amd64)

Some changes:

* Refactor nvidia-docker installations into its own file
* Change all subt testing runs to `tunnel_circuit_practice.ign`
* Implement the option to skip the squid proxy

**Tested:**

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-install-dockerhub-bionic-amd64&build=43)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-install-dockerhub-bionic-amd64/43/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-install-dockerhub-bionic-amd64/43/))

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64&build=515)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr\_any-bionic-amd64/515/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/515/))

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci_long-default-bionic-amd64&build=22)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci\_long-default-bionic-amd64/22/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci_long-default-bionic-amd64/22/))

values.title: fix capitalization in ign-CMAKE

values.description:
The `ignition-acropolis` deb [depends on `ignition-gazebo` and `libignition-launch-dev`](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-acropolis-release/src/8049802bee4b743283f99c9e991b8526297dff92/ubuntu/debian/control#lines-12), which in turn depended on `ignition-gazebo` as of version 0.2.0-2:

* https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch-release/commits/1a431edeb18f0fc07391933211d7cf4b646baf81

but `libignition-launch-dev` now [depends on `ignition-gazebo2`](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch-release/src/c78803f41060ddfd5f16e2b632b1f1325ee52c38/ubuntu/debian/control#lines-51), and I see a conflict when trying to install `ignition-gazebo` and `ignition-gazebo2` side-by-side (previously reported as [ign-gazebo issue 23](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/issues/23/ignition-gazebo-binaries-conflict-with), though it is marked as resolved):

~~~
dpkg: error processing archive /var/cache/apt/archives/ignition-gazebo_1.1.0-1~bionic_amd64.deb (--unpack):
 trying to overwrite '/usr/bin/ign-gazebo', which is also in package ignition-gazebo2 2.6.1-1~bionic
~~~

For now, I would just propose to disable the acropolis install job.
values.title: ignition_collection.dsl: disable acropolis install job

summary.raw:
The `ignition-acropolis` deb [depends on `ignition-gazebo` and `libignition-launch-dev`](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-acropolis-release/src/8049802bee4b743283f99c9e991b8526297dff92/ubuntu/debian/control#lines-12), which in turn depended on `ignition-gazebo` as of version 0.2.0-2:

* https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch-release/commits/1a431edeb18f0fc07391933211d7cf4b646baf81

but `libignition-launch-dev` now [depends on `ignition-gazebo2`](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch-release/src/c78803f41060ddfd5f16e2b632b1f1325ee52c38/ubuntu/debian/control#lines-51), and I see a conflict when trying to install `ignition-gazebo` and `ignition-gazebo2` side-by-side (previously reported as [ign-gazebo issue 23](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/issues/23/ignition-gazebo-binaries-conflict-with), though it is marked as resolved):

~~~
dpkg: error processing archive /var/cache/apt/archives/ignition-gazebo_1.1.0-1~bionic_amd64.deb (--unpack):
 trying to overwrite '/usr/bin/ign-gazebo', which is also in package ignition-gazebo2 2.6.1-1~bionic
~~~

For now, I would just propose to disable the acropolis install job.
summary.html:
The ignition-acropolis deb depends on ignition-gazebo and libignition-launch-dev, which in turn depended on ignition-gazebo as of version 0.2.0-2:

  • https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch-release/commits/1a431edeb18f0fc07391933211d7cf4b646baf81

but libignition-launch-dev now depends on ignition-gazebo2, and I see a conflict when trying to install ignition-gazebo and ignition-gazebo2 side-by-side (previously reported as ign-gazebo issue 23, though it is marked as resolved):

dpkg: error processing archive /var/cache/apt/archives/ignition-gazebo_1.1.0-1~bionic_amd64.deb (--unpack):
 trying to overwrite '/usr/bin/ign-gazebo', which is also in package ignition-gazebo2 2.6.1-1~bionic

For now, I would just propose to disable the acropolis install job.

values.description:
The correct branch for ign-launch in blueprint is `ign-launch1`. The nightly debbuild has been failing for a while:

values.description:
Delegate which repositories needs to be installed directly to gzdev. We are currently doing it now for -ci- jobs but not for -install- jobs.

This will remove current duplicity of setting up repositories needed in DSL for install jobs and foo-compilation.bash.

Tested here \(after running the DSL seed jobs\):

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_blueprint-install-pkg-bionic-amd64&build=132)

values.description:
This PR adds support for testing \(partially\) the[ instructions to install a local instance of subt infrastructure](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/cloudsim) . There is an error of communications some instructions that I leave commented out in the code that will require further debugging.

There is still value in testing build and run of the main docker images.

Tested:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-install-cloudsim_mirror-bionic-amd64&build=25)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-install-cloudsim\_mirror-bionic-amd64/25/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-install-cloudsim_mirror-bionic-amd64/25/))

values.description:
Some of the builds that use the smoke test end up frozen the build because the timeout sigint/sigkill does not finish the launch command. I’m moving out the smoke test from main PR -ci-any- to run it only in the long run overnight:

Tested:

* long:

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci_long-default-bionic-amd64&build=38)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci\_long-default-bionic-amd64/38/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci_long-default-bionic-amd64/38/))


* -ci-pr\_any-

    ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64&build=545)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr\_any-bionic-amd64/545/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/545/))

values.description:
The strip command in Ubuntu Disco is failing to generate the -dbg package because is trying to copy `dwz` files over themselves. I add a check here to the tool to avoid it.

Failing here [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/481/consoleFull#-15259915806ea37b8d-a6d4-40ae-8431-d90c018842af](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/481/consoleFull#-15259915806ea37b8d-a6d4-40ae-8431-d90c018842af)

Good build with this PR:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo9-debbuilder&build=483)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/483/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/483/))
values.title: Fix dh strip disco

summary.raw:
The strip command in Ubuntu Disco is failing to generate the -dbg package because is trying to copy `dwz` files over themselves. I add a check here to the tool to avoid it.

Failing here [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/481/consoleFull#-15259915806ea37b8d-a6d4-40ae-8431-d90c018842af](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/481/consoleFull#-15259915806ea37b8d-a6d4-40ae-8431-d90c018842af)

Good build with this PR:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo9-debbuilder&build=483)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/483/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/483/))
summary.html:
The strip command in Ubuntu Disco is failing to generate the -dbg package because is trying to copy dwz files over themselves. I add a check here to the tool to avoid it.

Failing here https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/481/consoleFull#-15259915806ea37b8d-a6d4-40ae-8431-d90c018842af

Good build with this PR:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/483/)

values.description:
Quick hack to stop the jenkins spam when trying to build software that we know it does not work on some particular arches.

This PR allows the option of create files with the prefix `.releasepy_NO_ARCH_` in:

* top root dir of a -release repository: this will affect all distributions and versions
* inside a distribution \(i.e. bionic\) directory: affects only the given distribution

Tested with this commit:

[https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo2-release/commits/cc7320eb5be3161ceeb6b22083642a1f4a49213c](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo2-release/commits/cc7320eb5be3161ceeb6b22083642a1f4a49213c)

Result:

```
Releasing for distributions: 
- bionic (amd64, i386)
```
values.title: -release repo configuration to skip arches when using release.py

summary.raw:
Quick hack to stop the jenkins spam when trying to build software that we know it does not work on some particular arches.

This PR allows the option of create files with the prefix `.releasepy_NO_ARCH_` in:

* top root dir of a -release repository: this will affect all distributions and versions
* inside a distribution \(i.e. bionic\) directory: affects only the given distribution

Tested with this commit:

[https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo2-release/commits/cc7320eb5be3161ceeb6b22083642a1f4a49213c](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo2-release/commits/cc7320eb5be3161ceeb6b22083642a1f4a49213c)

Result:

```
Releasing for distributions: 
- bionic (amd64, i386)
```
summary.html:
Quick hack to stop the jenkins spam when trying to build software that we know it does not work on some particular arches.

This PR allows the option of create files with the prefix .releasepy_NO_ARCH_ in:

  • top root dir of a -release repository: this will affect all distributions and versions
  • inside a distribution (i.e. bionic) directory: affects only the given distribution

Tested with this commit:

https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo2-release/commits/cc7320eb5be3161ceeb6b22083642a1f4a49213c

Result:

Releasing for distributions: 
- bionic (amd64, i386)

values.title: Remove old performance jobs from Jenkins

summary.raw: Clean up old performance jobs, mostly failing builds with no real use.
summary.html: Clean up old performance jobs, mostly failing builds with no real use.

values.description:
The new packages server has a different reprepro 'tag' \(an identifier used by apt repos\) than `packages.osrfoundation.org`. If we switch the DNS to point to the new machine apt is failing complaining about the change of the tag and requires all users to use `--allow-releaseinfo-chang` flag when running apt-get update.

To avoid this I’m going to change all the tags in the new packages server before we change the DNS. That will require us to run `--allow-releaseinfo-change `for the docker images that reuse the docker cache.
values.title: Use allow-releaseinfo-change to prevent failures when using packages testing server

summary.raw:
The new packages server has a different reprepro 'tag' \(an identifier used by apt repos\) than `packages.osrfoundation.org`. If we switch the DNS to point to the new machine apt is failing complaining about the change of the tag and requires all users to use `--allow-releaseinfo-chang` flag when running apt-get update.

To avoid this I’m going to change all the tags in the new packages server before we change the DNS. That will require us to run `--allow-releaseinfo-change `for the docker images that reuse the docker cache.
summary.html:
The new packages server has a different reprepro 'tag' (an identifier used by apt repos) than packages.osrfoundation.org. If we switch the DNS to point to the new machine apt is failing complaining about the change of the tag and requires all users to use --allow-releaseinfo-chang flag when running apt-get update.

To avoid this I’m going to change all the tags in the new packages server before we change the DNS. That will require us to run --allow-releaseinfo-changefor the docker images that reuse the docker cache.

values.description:
There was a problem with the 7zip application that frozen some of our Windows jobs. My findings ends up with the executable triggering some Windows GUIs instead of being use as a standalone tool.

This PR replaces the download of the installer/GUI exe by the real .exe \+ .dll installed by the installer.

Tested:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_msgs-ci-pr\_any-windows7-amd64/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/))
values.title: Replace 7zip executable on Windows builds

summary.raw:
There was a problem with the 7zip application that frozen some of our Windows jobs. My findings ends up with the executable triggering some Windows GUIs instead of being use as a standalone tool.

This PR replaces the download of the installer/GUI exe by the real .exe \+ .dll installed by the installer.

Tested:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_msgs-ci-pr\_any-windows7-amd64/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/))
summary.html:
There was a problem with the 7zip application that frozen some of our Windows jobs. My findings ends up with the executable triggering some Windows GUIs instead of being use as a standalone tool.

This PR replaces the download of the installer/GUI exe by the real .exe + .dll installed by the installer.

Tested:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/)

values.description:
We are going to use ignition citadel (c++17) dependencies with gazebo11, which requires bionic, so I've copied the logic from ignition.dsl to create the `ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto` and `abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto` jobs.

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo/571/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo/573/

I've also added logic to use gcc8 for gazebo >= 11 and am testing with a  pipeline script added in the following pull request:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3137/bitbucket-pipelinesyml-for-gazebo11-using/diff
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none&build=7)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none/7/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none/7/

~~We'll need to update the bitjen daemon to trigger the new jenkins jobs once this is merged.~~ Never mind, I think it will work fine either way.
values.title: Create gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto and USE_GCC8 for gazebo11+

summary.raw:
We are going to use ignition citadel (c++17) dependencies with gazebo11, which requires bionic, so I've copied the logic from ignition.dsl to create the `ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto` and `abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto` jobs.

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo/571/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo/573/

I've also added logic to use gcc8 for gazebo >= 11 and am testing with a  pipeline script added in the following pull request:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3137/bitbucket-pipelinesyml-for-gazebo11-using/diff
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none&build=7)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none/7/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none/7/

~~We'll need to update the bitjen daemon to trigger the new jenkins jobs once this is merged.~~ Never mind, I think it will work fine either way.
summary.html:
We are going to use ignition citadel (c++17) dependencies with gazebo11, which requires bionic, so I've copied the logic from ignition.dsl to create the ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto and abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto jobs.

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo/571/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo/573/

I've also added logic to use gcc8 for gazebo >= 11 and am testing with a pipeline script added in the following pull request:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3137/bitbucket-pipelinesyml-for-gazebo11-using/diff
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none/7/

We'll need to update the bitjen daemon to trigger the new jenkins jobs once this is merged. Never mind, I think it will work fine either way.

values.title: gazebo.dsl: use bionic for all gazebo-ci-default ubuntu jobs, since it now requires gcc8

summary.html:
I broke the gazebo-ci-default-xenial-* builds with pr #885, since gcc-8 is not available on xenial.

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/400/

This sets all the gazebo-ci-default ubuntu jobs to use bionic.

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo/578/
Added items:
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-nvidia'}

...
Unreferenced items:

    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci-default-xenial-i386-gpu-none'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci_BTCoverage-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none'}
Disabled items:
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci_BTCoverage-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci-default-xenial-i386-gpu-none'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci-coverage-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none'}
    GeneratedJob{name='gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none'}

It looks like the gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none job is gone, but there was no gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-none to replace it? never mind, that job existed before and still exists

values.description:
Homebrew is no longer building bottles for sierra, and the latest protobuf version doesn't have a sierra bottle:

* https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/commit/800b0f4b2fba1b50a1157ee216a2ddca75b52f0d

So we'll stop building them too.
values.title: stop building bottles on sierra

summary.raw:

So we'll stop building them too.

values.description:
* copy gazebo-base-windows.bat to gazebo9_10-base_windows.bat and use original for gazebo11

* gazebo-base-windows.bat: alphabetize dependencies, update transport/sdf branches, build ign-fuel-tools, and install ign-fuel-tools deps

testing against [gazebo PR 3147](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3147/gazebo11-add-helper-function-physicsengine/diff)
